entityTypes.label: Person
entityTypes.description: A human agent; core node for which personality is asserted. Properties: schema:name, ex:birthDate (optional), ex:alias.

entityTypes.label: Organization
entityTypes.description: An organization or employer. Properties: schema:name, schema:location.

entityTypes.label: Document
entityTypes.description: Source artefact (file, sentence). Holds minimal provenance like id, title, excerpt.

entityTypes.label: TraitAssertion
entityTypes.description: A reified assertion linking a Person to a PersonalityTrait plus score, confidence, and provenance metadata.

entityTypes.label: ExtractionRun
entityTypes.description: Execution record describing the pipeline run that produced assertions (tool versions, parameters).

relationTypes.description: Coarse relation (presence). Prefer using TraitAssertion for scores.
Points to the pipeline run that created the assertion.

traitRepresentation.rationale: A reified node stores score, confidence, measurement instrument, timestamp and provenance in a single place making numeric evaluation straightforward while keeping triples queryable.

fields.name: ex:measuredBy
fields.desc: instrument or method (e.g., BFI-44, lexicon-v1, model-v2)

fields.name: ex:extractedSpan
fields.desc: text span or offsets used to support the assertion

principles: Every TraitAssertion must include: prov:wasDerivedFrom (Document), ex:measuredBy (method id), ex:measuredAt (date) and ex:assertedBy (ExtractionRun).
Document nodes should include an excerpt and an id (no sensitive full-text by default).
ExtractionRun holds tool name/version, parameters and timestamp to make results reproducible.
provenanceModel.riskNote: Keep excerpt lengths small & avoid storing private data in Document nodes. Provenance metadata increases verbosity but is crucial for auditability.
